{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [ { "sha": "6990aad1ca6fc04333b8262999eb41efa69cc93f", "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync/how-to-prerequisites.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 14, "deletions": 12, "changes": 26, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-prerequisites.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-prerequisites.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-prerequisites.md?ref=eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b", "patch": "@@ -26,19 +26,21 @@ You need the following to use Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync:\n \n - Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync agent must be installed on a domain-joined server that runs Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, or Windows Server 2016. We recommend Windows Server 2022. You can deploy Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync on Windows Server 2016, but since it's in extended support, you might need [a paid support program](/lifecycle/policies/fixed#extended-support) if you require support for this configuration. Installing on unsupported versions of Windows Server may cause service failures or unexpected behavior.\n \n-- This server should be a tier 0 server based on the [Active Directory administrative tier model](/security/privileged-access-workstations/privileged-access-access-model). Installing the agent on a domain controller is supported. For more information, see [Harden your Microsoft Entra provisioning agent server](#harden-your-microsoft-entra-provisioning-agent-server)\n+> [!IMPORTANT]\n+> **Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n+> ```\n+> Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n+> ```\n+> >\n+> ```\n+> >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n+> ```\n+> >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n+> ```\n+> After applying this registry modification, you must restart the server for the change to take effect.\n+> This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync is planned for a future release.\n \n- >[!IMPORTANT]\n- >**Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Connect Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n- >\n- >```\n- >Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n- >\n- >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n- >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n- >```\n- >\n- >This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync is planned for a future release.\n+- This server should be a tier 0 server based on the [Active Directory administrative tier model](/security/privileged-access-workstations/privileged-access-access-model). Installing the agent on a domain controller is supported. For more information, see [Harden your Microsoft Entra provisioning agent server](#harden-your-microsoft-entra-provisioning-agent-server)\n \n - The Active Directory Schema is required to have the attribute msDS-ExternalDirectoryObjectId, which is available in Windows Server 2016 and later.\n " }, { "sha": "00400a06fa058e1221874247ec4aa1bd403639a2", "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-fed-group-claims.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 3, "deletions": 2, "changes": 5, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-fed-group-claims.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-fed-group-claims.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-fed-group-claims.md?ref=eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b", "patch": "@@ -162,8 +162,7 @@ Some applications require the group membership information to appear in the role\n Group filtering allows for fine control of the list of groups that's included as part of the group claim. When a filter is configured, only groups that match the filter will be included in the group's claim that's sent to that application. The filter will be applied against all groups regardless of the group hierarchy.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n-> Group filtering applies to tokens emitted for apps where group claims and filtering was configured in the **Enterprise apps** blade in the portal. \n-> Group filtering does not apply to Microsoft Entra roles.\n+> Group filtering applies to tokens emitted for apps where group claims and filtering was configured in the **Enterprise apps** blade in the portal. Group filtering does not apply to Microsoft Entra roles.\n \n You can configure filters to be applied to the group's display name or `SAMAccountName` attribute. The following filtering operations are supported: \n \n@@ -173,6 +172,8 @@ You can configure filters to be applied to the group's display name or `SAMAccou\n \n ![Screenshot that shows filtering options.](media/how-to-connect-fed-group-claims/group-filter-1.png)\n \n+**Group Filtering Limitations**: Microsoft Entra ID supports group filtering only if a user belongs to 1,000 or fewer groups (including direct and transitive memberships). If this limit is exceeded, filtering won’t apply and an overage claim is sent instead.\n+\n #### Group transformation\n Some applications might require the groups in a different format from how they're represented in Microsoft Entra ID. To support this requirement, you can apply a transformation to each group that will be emitted in the group claim. You achieve it by allowing the configuration of a regular expression (regex) and a replacement value on custom group claims. \n " }, { "sha": "4cbc4711fc4bba063f2543e922f521cb30e3831e", "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 15, "deletions": 12, "changes": 27, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md?ref=eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b", "patch": "@@ -65,18 +65,21 @@ To read more about securing your Active Directory environment, see [Best practic\n \n - Microsoft Entra Connect must be installed on a domain-joined server that runs Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, or Windows Server 2016. We recommend Windows Server 2022. You can deploy Microsoft Entra Connect on Windows Server 2016. However, since Windows Server 2016 is in extended support, you might need [a paid support program](/lifecycle/policies/fixed#extended-support) if you require support for this configuration. Installing on unsupported versions of Windows Server may cause service failures or unexpected behavior.\n \n- >[!IMPORTANT]\n- >**Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Connect Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n- >\n- >```\n- >Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n- >\n- >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n- >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n- >```\n- >\n- >This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Connect Sync is planned for a future release.\n-\n+ > [!IMPORTANT]\n+ > **Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Connect Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n+> \n+ > ```\n+ > Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n+ > ```\n+ > >\n+ > ```\n+ > >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n+ > ```\n+ > >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n+ > ```\n+ > After applying this registry modification, **you must restart the server** for the change to take effect.\n+ > This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Connect Sync is planned for a future release.\n+ \n - The minimum .NET Framework version required is 4.6.2, and newer versions of .NET are also supported. The .NET version 4.8 and greater offers the best accessibility compliance.\n - Microsoft Entra Connect can't be installed on Small Business Server or Windows Server Essentials before 2019 (Windows Server Essentials 2019 is supported). The server must be using Windows Server standard or better. \n - The Microsoft Entra Connect server must have a full GUI installed. Installing Microsoft Entra Connect on Windows Server Core isn't supported. " }, { "sha": "81ef899d98ad9e90971b2329df639e6c0c87393d", "filename": "docs/includes/entra-service-limits-include.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 1, "changes": 2, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-service-limits-include.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-service-limits-include.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-service-limits-include.md?ref=eaedcb2a32542a72b0fbe2a4e9a1ad91ddf8bb7b", "patch": "@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@ Here are the usage constraints and other service limits for the Microsoft Entra\n | Schema extensions |
  • String-type extensions can have a maximum of 256 characters.
  • Binary-type extensions are limited to 256 bytes.
  • Only 100 extension values, across *all* types and *all* applications, can be written to any single Microsoft Entra resource.
  • Only User, Group, TenantDetail, Device, Application, and ServicePrincipal entities can be extended with string-type or binary-type single-valued attributes.
  • Only the \"equals\" operator is supported for DateTime-type extensions. Range operators like \"greater than\" or \"less than\" are not supported.
|\n | Applications |
  • A maximum of 100 users and service principals can be owners of a single application.
  • A user, group, or service principal can have a maximum of 1,500 app role assignments. The limitation is on the assigned service principal, user, or group across all app roles and not on the number of assignments of a single app role. This limit includes app role assignments where the resource service principal has been soft-deleted.
  • A user can have credentials configured for a maximum of 48 apps using password-based single sign-on. This limit only applies for credentials configured when the user is directly assigned the app, not when the user is a member of a group that is assigned.
  • A group can have credentials configured for a maximum of 48 apps using password-based single sign-on.
  • See additional limits in [Validation differences by supported account types](~/identity-platform/supported-accounts-validation.md).
|\n |Application manifest |A maximum of 1,200 entries can be added to the application manifest.
See additional limits in [Validation differences by supported account types](~/identity-platform/supported-accounts-validation.md). |\n-| Groups |
  • A non-admin user can create a maximum of 250 groups in a Microsoft Entra organization. Any Microsoft Entra admin who can manage groups in the organization can also create an unlimited number of groups (up to the Microsoft Entra object limit). If you assign a role to a user to remove the limit for that user, assign a less privileged, built-in role such as User Administrator or Groups Administrator.
  • A Microsoft Entra organization can have a maximum of 15,000 dynamic groups (including those originating from Microsoft Entra entitlement management automatic assignment policies) and dynamic administrative units combined.
  • A maximum of 500 [role-assignable groups](~/identity/role-based-access-control/groups-concept.md) can be created in a single Microsoft Entra organization (tenant).
  • A maximum of 100 users can be owners of a single group.
  • There is a limit of 1010 groups per token allowed for [Entra Kerberos](/troubleshoot/windows-server/windows-security/logging-on-user-account-fails).
  • Any number of Microsoft Entra resources can be members of a single group.
  • If a user (or group) is a member of more than 2,048 groups (direct and nested), their access might be blocked. This limit applies to both direct and nested group memberships. See [Users, groups, and workload identities assignments in Conditional Access](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-users-groups.md).
  • A user can be a member of any number of groups. The following service-specific limits apply when group memberships are used in authentication or authorization (including direct and indirect memberships):
    • SharePoint Online: When security groups are used with SharePoint Online, a user can be a part of up to 2,047 security groups in total, including direct and indirect membership. When this limit is exceeded, authentication and search results can become unpredictable. See [SharePoint limits](/office365/servicedescriptions/sharepoint-online-service-description/sharepoint-online-limits).
    • SAML tokens: If optional groups claims are enabled, up to 150 group memberships (including nested groups) are included in SAML assertions. If a user is in more than 150 groups, the groups claim is omitted and an overage claim is sent instead. See [Configure optional claims](~/identity-platform/optional-claims.md) and the [SAML token claims reference](~/identity-platform/reference-saml-tokens.md#claims-in-saml-tokens) for implementation guidance.
    • JWT/OIDC tokens: If optional groups claims are enabled, up to 200 group memberships (including nested groups) are included in JWT tokens. If a user is in more than 200 groups, the groups claim is omitted and an overage claim is sent instead. See [Configure optional claims](~/identity-platform/optional-claims.md) and the [Access token claims reference](~/identity-platform/access-token-claims-reference.md#payload-claims) for implementation guidance.
    • Conditional Access policies: Policy evaluation supports up to 4,096 group memberships per user (direct and indirect). When this limit is exceeded, policy enforcement might fail. See [Users, groups, and workload identities assignments in Conditional Access](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-users-groups.md).
  • Starting with Microsoft Entra Connect v2.0, the V2 endpoint is the default API. The number of members in a group that you can synchronize from your on-premises Active Directory to Microsoft Entra ID by using Microsoft Entra Connect is limited to 250,000 members. For more information, see [Microsoft Entra Connect Sync V2](../identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-sync-endpoint-api-v2.md).
  • When you select a list of groups, you can assign a group expiration policy to a maximum of 500 Microsoft 365 groups. There's no limit when the policy is applied to all Microsoft 365 groups.

At this time, the following scenarios are supported with nested groups:
  • One group can be added as a member of another group, and you can achieve group nesting.
  • Group membership claims. When an app is configured to receive group membership claims in the token, nested groups in which the signed-in user is a member are included.
  • Conditional Access (when a Conditional Access policy has a group scope).
  • Restricting access to self-serve password reset.
  • Restricting which users can do Microsoft Entra join and device registration.

The following scenarios are not supported with nested groups:
  • App role assignment, for both access and provisioning. Assigning groups to an app is supported, but any groups nested within the directly assigned group won't have access.
  • Group-based licensing (assigning a license automatically to all members of a group).
  • Microsoft 365 Groups.
|\n+| Groups |
  • A non-admin user can create a maximum of 250 groups in a Microsoft Entra organization. Any Microsoft Entra admin who can manage groups in the organization can also create an unlimited number of groups (up to the Microsoft Entra object limit). If you assign a role to a user to remove the limit for that user, assign a less privileged, built-in role such as User Administrator or Groups Administrator.
  • A Microsoft Entra organization can have a maximum of 15,000 dynamic groups (including those originating from Microsoft Entra entitlement management automatic assignment policies) and dynamic administrative units combined.
  • A maximum of 500 [role-assignable groups](~/identity/role-based-access-control/groups-concept.md) can be created in a single Microsoft Entra organization (tenant).
  • A maximum of 100 users can be owners of a single group.
  • There is a limit of 1010 groups per token allowed for [Entra Kerberos](/troubleshoot/windows-server/windows-security/logging-on-user-account-fails).
  • Any number of Microsoft Entra resources can be members of a single group.
  • If a user (or group) is a member of more than 2,048 groups (direct and nested), their access might be blocked. This limit applies to both direct and nested group memberships. See [Users, groups, and workload identities assignments in Conditional Access](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-users-groups.md).
  • A user can be a member of any number of groups. The following service-specific limits apply when group memberships are used in authentication or authorization (including direct and indirect memberships):
    • SharePoint Online: When security groups are used with SharePoint Online, a user can be a part of up to 2,047 security groups in total, including direct and indirect membership. When this limit is exceeded, authentication and search results can become unpredictable. See [SharePoint limits](/office365/servicedescriptions/sharepoint-online-service-description/sharepoint-online-limits).
    • SAML tokens: If optional groups claims are enabled, up to 150 group memberships (including nested groups) are included in SAML assertions. If a user is in more than 150 groups, the groups claim is omitted and an overage claim is sent instead. Microsoft Entra ID supports group filtering only if a user belongs to 1,000 or fewer groups (including direct and transitive memberships). If this limit is exceeded, filtering won’t apply and an overage claim is sent instead. See [Configure optional claims](~/identity-platform/optional-claims.md) and the [SAML token claims reference](~/identity-platform/reference-saml-tokens.md#claims-in-saml-tokens) for implementation guidance.
    • JWT/OIDC tokens: If optional groups claims are enabled, up to 200 group memberships (including nested groups) are included in JWT tokens. If a user is in more than 200 groups, the groups claim is omitted and an overage claim is sent instead. See [Configure optional claims](~/identity-platform/optional-claims.md) and the [Access token claims reference](~/identity-platform/access-token-claims-reference.md#payload-claims) for implementation guidance.
    • Conditional Access policies: Policy evaluation supports up to 4,096 group memberships per user (direct and indirect). When this limit is exceeded, policy enforcement might fail. See [Users, groups, and workload identities assignments in Conditional Access](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-users-groups.md).
  • Starting with Microsoft Entra Connect v2.0, the V2 endpoint is the default API. The number of members in a group that you can synchronize from your on-premises Active Directory to Microsoft Entra ID by using Microsoft Entra Connect is limited to 250,000 members. For more information, see [Microsoft Entra Connect Sync V2](../identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-sync-endpoint-api-v2.md).
  • When you select a list of groups, you can assign a group expiration policy to a maximum of 500 Microsoft 365 groups. There's no limit when the policy is applied to all Microsoft 365 groups.

At this time, the following scenarios are supported with nested groups:
  • One group can be added as a member of another group, and you can achieve group nesting.
  • Group membership claims. When an app is configured to receive group membership claims in the token, nested groups in which the signed-in user is a member are included.
  • Conditional Access (when a Conditional Access policy has a group scope).
  • Restricting access to self-serve password reset.
  • Restricting which users can do Microsoft Entra join and device registration.

The following scenarios are not supported with nested groups:
  • App role assignment, for both access and provisioning. Assigning groups to an app is supported, but any groups nested within the directly assigned group won't have access.
  • Group-based licensing (assigning a license automatically to all members of a group).
  • Microsoft 365 Groups.
|\n | Application Proxy |
  • A maximum of 500 transactions* per second per Application Proxy application.
  • A maximum of 750 transactions per second for the Microsoft Entra organization.

*A transaction is defined as a single HTTP request and response for a unique resource. When clients are throttled, they receive a 429 response (too many requests). Transaction metrics are collected on each connector and can be monitored using performance counters under the object name `Microsoft Entra private network connector`. |\n | Access Panel |There's no limit to the number of applications per user that can be displayed in the Access Panel, regardless of the number of assigned licenses. |\n | Reports | A maximum of 1,000 rows can be viewed or downloaded in any report. Any additional data is truncated. |" } ]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
The commits address several important updates and clarifications for Microsoft Entra hybrid identity configurations.

Firstly, a critical advisory has been added regarding the incompatibility of Windows Server 2025 with Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync and Microsoft Entra Connect, including a registry workaround for affected installations.

Secondly, the documentation for group claims in federated scenarios has been enhanced with information on group filtering limitations.

Finally, a minor correction has been made to the limits document, specifying the group filtering capability within SAML tokens more precisely.

author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
message:
Merge pull request #10077 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-10-21 05:02 UTC

There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n+> ```\n+> Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n+> ```\n+> >\n+> ```\n+> >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n+> ```\n+> >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n+> ```\n+> After applying this registry modification, you must restart the server for the change to take effect.\n+> This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync is planned for a future release.\n \n- >[!IMPORTANT]\n- >**Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Connect Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n- >\n- >```\n- >Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n- >\n- >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n- >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n- >```\n- >\n- >This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync is planned for a future release.\n+- This server should be a tier 0 server based on the [Active Directory administrative tier model](/security/privileged-access-workstations/privileged-access-access-model). Installing the agent on a domain controller is supported. For more information, see [Harden your Microsoft Entra provisioning agent server](#harden-your-microsoft-entra-provisioning-agent-server)\n \n - The Active Directory Schema is required to have the attribute msDS-ExternalDirectoryObjectId, which is available in Windows Server 2016 and later.\n " }, { "sha": "00400a06fa058e1221874247ec4aa1bd403639a2", "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-fed-group-claims.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 3, "deletions": 2, "changes": 5, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/daf6b19bce93e9c1b655ff62e54147ac5c186008/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-fed-group-claims.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/daf6b19bce93e9c1b655ff62e54147ac5c186008/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-fed-group-claims.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-fed-group-claims.md?ref=daf6b19bce93e9c1b655ff62e54147ac5c186008", "patch": "@@ -162,8 +162,7 @@ Some applications require the group membership information to appear in the role\n Group filtering allows for fine control of the list of groups that's included as part of the group claim. When a filter is configured, only groups that match the filter will be included in the group's claim that's sent to that application. The filter will be applied against all groups regardless of the group hierarchy.\n \n > [!NOTE]\n-> Group filtering applies to tokens emitted for apps where group claims and filtering was configured in the **Enterprise apps** blade in the portal. \n-> Group filtering does not apply to Microsoft Entra roles.\n+> Group filtering applies to tokens emitted for apps where group claims and filtering was configured in the **Enterprise apps** blade in the portal. Group filtering does not apply to Microsoft Entra roles.\n \n You can configure filters to be applied to the group's display name or `SAMAccountName` attribute. The following filtering operations are supported: \n \n@@ -173,6 +172,8 @@ You can configure filters to be applied to the group's display name or `SAMAccou\n \n ![Screenshot that shows filtering options.](media/how-to-connect-fed-group-claims/group-filter-1.png)\n \n+**Group Filtering Limitations**: Microsoft Entra ID supports group filtering only if a user belongs to 1,000 or fewer groups (including direct and transitive memberships). If this limit is exceeded, filtering won’t apply and an overage claim is sent instead.\n+\n #### Group transformation\n Some applications might require the groups in a different format from how they're represented in Microsoft Entra ID. To support this requirement, you can apply a transformation to each group that will be emitted in the group claim. You achieve it by allowing the configuration of a regular expression (regex) and a replacement value on custom group claims. \n " }, { "sha": "4cbc4711fc4bba063f2543e922f521cb30e3831e", "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 15, "deletions": 12, "changes": 27, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/daf6b19bce93e9c1b655ff62e54147ac5c186008/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/daf6b19bce93e9c1b655ff62e54147ac5c186008/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconnect%2Fhow-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md?ref=daf6b19bce93e9c1b655ff62e54147ac5c186008", "patch": "@@ -65,18 +65,21 @@ To read more about securing your Active Directory environment, see [Best practic\n \n - Microsoft Entra Connect must be installed on a domain-joined server that runs Windows Server 2022, Windows Server 2019, or Windows Server 2016. We recommend Windows Server 2022. You can deploy Microsoft Entra Connect on Windows Server 2016. However, since Windows Server 2016 is in extended support, you might need [a paid support program](/lifecycle/policies/fixed#extended-support) if you require support for this configuration. Installing on unsupported versions of Windows Server may cause service failures or unexpected behavior.\n \n- >[!IMPORTANT]\n- >**Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Connect Sync is planned for a future release.\n-\n+ > [!IMPORTANT]\n+ > **Windows Server 2025 is NOT supported. There is a known issue on Windows server 2025 with the [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9) update installed that will cause Microsoft Entra Connect Sync to encounter sync issues.** If you upgraded to Windows Server 2025 and installed update [KB5065426](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/september-9-2025-kb5065426-os-build-26100-6584-77a41d9b-1b7c-4198-b9a5-3c4b6706dea9), apply the following registry key as soon as possible to avoid sync disruption.\n+> \n+ > ```\n+ > Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00\n+ > ```\n+ > >\n+ > ```\n+ > >[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Policies\\Microsoft\\FeatureManagement\\Overrides]\n+ > ```\n+ > >\"2362988687\"=dword:00000000\n+ > ```\n+ > After applying this registry modification, **you must restart the server** for the change to take effect.\n+ > This registry modification is a workaround. Windows Server 2025 support for Microsoft Entra Connect Sync is planned for a future release.\n+ \n - The minimum .NET Framework version required is 4.6.2, and newer versions of .NET are also supported. The .NET version 4.8 and greater offers the best accessibility compliance.\n - Microsoft Entra Connect can't be installed on Small Business Server or Windows Server Essentials before 2019 (Windows Server Essentials 2019 is supported). The server must be using Windows Server standard or better. \n - The Microsoft Entra Connect server must have a full GUI installed. Installing Microsoft Entra Connect on Windows Server Core isn't supported. " }, { "sha": "81ef899d98ad9e90971b2329df639e6c0c87393d", "filename": "docs/includes/entra-service-limits-include.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 1, "changes": 2, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/daf6b19bce93e9c1b655ff62e54147ac5c186008/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-service-limits-include.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/daf6b19bce93e9c1b655ff62e54147ac5c186008/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-service-limits-include.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fentra-service-limits-include.md?ref=daf6b19bce93e9c1b655ff62e54147ac5c186008", "patch": "@@ -19,7 +19,7 @@ Here are the usage constraints and other service limits for the Microsoft Entra\n | Schema extensions |
  • String-type extensions can have a maximum of 256 characters.
  • Binary-type extensions are limited to 256 bytes.
  • Only 100 extension values, across *all* types and *all* applications, can be written to any single Microsoft Entra resource.
  • Only User, Group, TenantDetail, Device, Application, and ServicePrincipal entities can be extended with string-type or binary-type single-valued attributes.
  • Only the \"equals\" operator is supported for DateTime-type extensions. Range operators like \"greater than\" or \"less than\" are not supported.
|\n | Applications |
  • A maximum of 100 users and service principals can be owners of a single application.
  • A user, group, or service principal can have a maximum of 1,500 app role assignments. The limitation is on the assigned service principal, user, or group across all app roles and not on the number of assignments of a single app role. This limit includes app role assignments where the resource service principal has been soft-deleted.
  • A user can have credentials configured for a maximum of 48 apps using password-based single sign-on. This limit only applies for credentials configured when the user is directly assigned the app, not when the user is a member of a group that is assigned.
  • A group can have credentials configured for a maximum of 48 apps using password-based single sign-on.
  • See additional limits in [Validation differences by supported account types](~/identity-platform/supported-accounts-validation.md).
|\n |Application manifest |A maximum of 1,200 entries can be added to the application manifest.
See additional limits in [Validation differences by supported account types](~/identity-platform/supported-accounts-validation.md). |\n-| Groups |
  • A non-admin user can create a maximum of 250 groups in a Microsoft Entra organization. Any Microsoft Entra admin who can manage groups in the organization can also create an unlimited number of groups (up to the Microsoft Entra object limit). If you assign a role to a user to remove the limit for that user, assign a less privileged, built-in role such as User Administrator or Groups Administrator.
  • A Microsoft Entra organization can have a maximum of 15,000 dynamic groups (including those originating from Microsoft Entra entitlement management automatic assignment policies) and dynamic administrative units combined.
  • A maximum of 500 [role-assignable groups](~/identity/role-based-access-control/groups-concept.md) can be created in a single Microsoft Entra organization (tenant).
  • A maximum of 100 users can be owners of a single group.
  • There is a limit of 1010 groups per token allowed for [Entra Kerberos](/troubleshoot/windows-server/windows-security/logging-on-user-account-fails).
  • Any number of Microsoft Entra resources can be members of a single group.
  • If a user (or group) is a member of more than 2,048 groups (direct and nested), their access might be blocked. This limit applies to both direct and nested group memberships. See [Users, groups, and workload identities assignments in Conditional Access](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-users-groups.md).
  • A user can be a member of any number of groups. The following service-specific limits apply when group memberships are used in authentication or authorization (including direct and indirect memberships):
    • SharePoint Online: When security groups are used with SharePoint Online, a user can be a part of up to 2,047 security groups in total, including direct and indirect membership. When this limit is exceeded, authentication and search results can become unpredictable. See [SharePoint limits](/office365/servicedescriptions/sharepoint-online-service-description/sharepoint-online-limits).
    • SAML tokens: If optional groups claims are enabled, up to 150 group memberships (including nested groups) are included in SAML assertions. If a user is in more than 150 groups, the groups claim is omitted and an overage claim is sent instead. See [Configure optional claims](~/identity-platform/optional-claims.md) and the [SAML token claims reference](~/identity-platform/reference-saml-tokens.md#claims-in-saml-tokens) for implementation guidance.
    • JWT/OIDC tokens: If optional groups claims are enabled, up to 200 group memberships (including nested groups) are included in JWT tokens. If a user is in more than 200 groups, the groups claim is omitted and an overage claim is sent instead. See [Configure optional claims](~/identity-platform/optional-claims.md) and the [Access token claims reference](~/identity-platform/access-token-claims-reference.md#payload-claims) for implementation guidance.
    • Conditional Access policies: Policy evaluation supports up to 4,096 group memberships per user (direct and indirect). When this limit is exceeded, policy enforcement might fail. See [Users, groups, and workload identities assignments in Conditional Access](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-users-groups.md).
  • Starting with Microsoft Entra Connect v2.0, the V2 endpoint is the default API. The number of members in a group that you can synchronize from your on-premises Active Directory to Microsoft Entra ID by using Microsoft Entra Connect is limited to 250,000 members. For more information, see [Microsoft Entra Connect Sync V2](../identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-sync-endpoint-api-v2.md).
  • When you select a list of groups, you can assign a group expiration policy to a maximum of 500 Microsoft 365 groups. There's no limit when the policy is applied to all Microsoft 365 groups.

At this time, the following scenarios are supported with nested groups:
  • One group can be added as a member of another group, and you can achieve group nesting.
  • Group membership claims. When an app is configured to receive group membership claims in the token, nested groups in which the signed-in user is a member are included.
  • Conditional Access (when a Conditional Access policy has a group scope).
  • Restricting access to self-serve password reset.
  • Restricting which users can do Microsoft Entra join and device registration.

The following scenarios are not supported with nested groups:
  • App role assignment, for both access and provisioning. Assigning groups to an app is supported, but any groups nested within the directly assigned group won't have access.
  • Group-based licensing (assigning a license automatically to all members of a group).
  • Microsoft 365 Groups.
|\n+| Groups |
  • A non-admin user can create a maximum of 250 groups in a Microsoft Entra organization. Any Microsoft Entra admin who can manage groups in the organization can also create an unlimited number of groups (up to the Microsoft Entra object limit). If you assign a role to a user to remove the limit for that user, assign a less privileged, built-in role such as User Administrator or Groups Administrator.
  • A Microsoft Entra organization can have a maximum of 15,000 dynamic groups (including those originating from Microsoft Entra entitlement management automatic assignment policies) and dynamic administrative units combined.
  • A maximum of 500 [role-assignable groups](~/identity/role-based-access-control/groups-concept.md) can be created in a single Microsoft Entra organization (tenant).
  • A maximum of 100 users can be owners of a single group.
  • There is a limit of 1010 groups per token allowed for [Entra Kerberos](/troubleshoot/windows-server/windows-security/logging-on-user-account-fails).
  • Any number of Microsoft Entra resources can be members of a single group.
  • If a user (or group) is a member of more than 2,048 groups (direct and nested), their access might be blocked. This limit applies to both direct and nested group memberships. See [Users, groups, and workload identities assignments in Conditional Access](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-users-groups.md).
  • A user can be a member of any number of groups. The following service-specific limits apply when group memberships are used in authentication or authorization (including direct and indirect memberships):
    • SharePoint Online: When security groups are used with SharePoint Online, a user can be a part of up to 2,047 security groups in total, including direct and indirect membership. When this limit is exceeded, authentication and search results can become unpredictable. See [SharePoint limits](/office365/servicedescriptions/sharepoint-online-service-description/sharepoint-online-limits).
    • SAML tokens: If optional groups claims are enabled, up to 150 group memberships (including nested groups) are included in SAML assertions. If a user is in more than 150 groups, the groups claim is omitted and an overage claim is sent instead. Microsoft Entra ID supports group filtering only if a user belongs to 1,000 or fewer groups (including direct and transitive memberships). If this limit is exceeded, filtering won’t apply and an overage claim is sent instead. See [Configure optional claims](~/identity-platform/optional-claims.md) and the [SAML token claims reference](~/identity-platform/reference-saml-tokens.md#claims-in-saml-tokens) for implementation guidance.
    • JWT/OIDC tokens: If optional groups claims are enabled, up to 200 group memberships (including nested groups) are included in JWT tokens. If a user is in more than 200 groups, the groups claim is omitted and an overage claim is sent instead. See [Configure optional claims](~/identity-platform/optional-claims.md) and the [Access token claims reference](~/identity-platform/access-token-claims-reference.md#payload-claims) for implementation guidance.
    • Conditional Access policies: Policy evaluation supports up to 4,096 group memberships per user (direct and indirect). When this limit is exceeded, policy enforcement might fail. See [Users, groups, and workload identities assignments in Conditional Access](~/identity/conditional-access/concept-conditional-access-users-groups.md).
  • Starting with Microsoft Entra Connect v2.0, the V2 endpoint is the default API. The number of members in a group that you can synchronize from your on-premises Active Directory to Microsoft Entra ID by using Microsoft Entra Connect is limited to 250,000 members. For more information, see [Microsoft Entra Connect Sync V2](../identity/hybrid/connect/how-to-connect-sync-endpoint-api-v2.md).
  • When you select a list of groups, you can assign a group expiration policy to a maximum of 500 Microsoft 365 groups. There's no limit when the policy is applied to all Microsoft 365 groups.

At this time, the following scenarios are supported with nested groups:
  • One group can be added as a member of another group, and you can achieve group nesting.
  • Group membership claims. When an app is configured to receive group membership claims in the token, nested groups in which the signed-in user is a member are included.
  • Conditional Access (when a Conditional Access policy has a group scope).
  • Restricting access to self-serve password reset.
  • Restricting which users can do Microsoft Entra join and device registration.

The following scenarios are not supported with nested groups:
  • App role assignment, for both access and provisioning. Assigning groups to an app is supported, but any groups nested within the directly assigned group won't have access.
  • Group-based licensing (assigning a license automatically to all members of a group).
  • Microsoft 365 Groups.
|\n | Application Proxy |
  • A maximum of 500 transactions* per second per Application Proxy application.
  • A maximum of 750 transactions per second for the Microsoft Entra organization.

*A transaction is defined as a single HTTP request and response for a unique resource. When clients are throttled, they receive a 429 response (too many requests). Transaction metrics are collected on each connector and can be monitored using performance counters under the object name `Microsoft Entra private network connector`. |\n | Access Panel |There's no limit to the number of applications per user that can be displayed in the Access Panel, regardless of the number of assigned licenses. |\n | Reports | A maximum of 1,000 rows can be viewed or downloaded in any report. Any additional data is truncated. |" } ]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
This commit updates several documentation files related to Microsoft Entra Connect and Cloud Sync.

Key changes include:

*   **Windows Server 2025 Support:** Both `how-to-prerequisites.md` for Cloud Sync and `how-to-connect-install-prerequisites.md` for Entra Connect now explicitly state that Windows Server 2025 is *not* supported due to a known issue with a specific update (KB5065426). A registry workaround is provided for affected users, and official support is noted as planned for a future release.
*   **Group Filtering in Entra Connect:** The documentation for configuring group claims in Entra Connect (`how-to-connect-fed-group-claims.md`) now clarifies limitations for group filtering, stating that it only applies if a user belongs to 1,000 or fewer groups, otherwise an overage claim is sent. This information has also been integrated into the general service limits document (`entra-service-limits-include.md`).
*   **Minor Tweaks:** Some minor formatting and wording adjustments have been made across the files.
